definition: to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Lobbyists in Washington have been delighted by all this new activity.
sentences.chinese: 華盛頓的遊說團體對於這些新活動一直欣喜不已。

sentences.english: John is lobbying some members of the legislature.
sentences.chinese: 約翰在對一些立法委員們進行遊說。

sentences.english: Lobby groups could water down plans that will cost industry money.
sentences.chinese: 遊說團體可以沖淡這個耗費企業資金的計劃。

sentences.english: The cotton farmers lobbied this bill through.
sentences.chinese: 棉農通過遊說使這一議案得以通過。

sentences.english: I saw her father with his rosette on, canvassing for the Conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 我看見她父親戴着玫瑰花結，正在爲保守黨遊說拉票。

sentences.english: Business lobbyists were girding for battle even before the budget's unveiling.
sentences.chinese: 商業遊說組織則早在預算案公佈之前就已準備迎戰。

sentences.english: I know one investment banking boss who penalises underlings for lobbying crassly .
sentences.chinese: 我認識的一位投行老闆就會懲罰那些過分遊說的下級。

sentences.english: The business lobby pushed back, and Canada-China relations were chilled.
sentences.chinese: 結果商界遊說團反撲，加中關係冷卻。

sentences.english: I convinced him to invest in this company.
sentences.chinese: 在我的遊說下，他同意投資我們公司。

sentences.english: Phoebe wants to keep one of the babies and manipulates Rachel into asking for her.
sentences.chinese: 菲比想留下一個孩子，請瑞秋去遊說。

sentences.english: The company directed me to travel into the wilderness by boat to canvass the resident natives.
sentences.chinese: 公司指示我坐船進入一片荒野，去遊說當地居民。

sentences.english: The White House has also stepped up its efforts to shepherd the bill through the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 白宮也已經加緊努力，遊說在參議院通過該法案。

sentences.english: They were busy canvassing and drumming up sentiment against the new government.
sentences.chinese: 他們當時正忙於遊說，挑起對新政府的不滿情緒。

sentences.english: There is a mixture of truth competing with mal-intentioned-lobbyist-backed misinformation.
sentences.chinese: 真相中會參雜着惡意遊說支持誤傳。

sentences.english: The ruling was welcomed by BusinessEurope, the lobbying group. “The W.T.O.
sentences.chinese: 這項裁決受到了遊說團體“商業歐洲”的歡迎。

sentences.english: They adopted the resolution despite lobbying and threats from Japan’s right-wing forces.
sentences.chinese: 他們不管日本右翼勢力的遊說和威脅採納了這個決議。

definition: to use gain as a lure
to take turns/to work by roster
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
